page.title: 02Loch Leven, Kinross-shire
page.content: A large part of our block, 38.5% of it, forms the northern end of{Loch {Leven. }Round the shore of the loch are nature reserves controlled by The Nature Conservancy Council. The public are allowed on only a few restricted sites, access to which was provided under an agreement with Kinross Estates in 1964. One of these sites is Burleigh Sands. It has a good car park and picnic area set under Scots pines, and is visited by local people and summer visitors. Many bird species nest around the shore but some seem to prefer the islands in the loch because foxes are active in the area. The loch is stocked with{Loch Leven {Trout,}which has a deep pink or red flesh and is very tasty. The loch is a popular venue for anglers who hire boats from the pier near{Kinross.
